meanings.definition: Of or relating to the palate.
meanings.sent1: The palatine taste of the soup was delightful.
meanings.sent2: Her palatine preference for sweet foods was well-known.
meanings.sent3: The palatine flavors in the dish danced on her tongue.
meanings.sent4: The palatine sensation of the spices lingered in her mouth.
meanings.sent5: The palatine sensation of the ice cream was refreshing on a hot day.

meanings.definition: A high official in certain European countries.
meanings.sent1: The palatine attended the royal banquet.
meanings.sent2: The palatine's duties included overseeing the kingdom's finances.
meanings.sent3: The palatine's extravagant hat caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The palatine's presence commanded respect in the court.
meanings.sent5: The palatine's elegant attire reflected his status.

meanings.definition: A nobleman in the Roman Empire.
meanings.sent1: The palatine owned vast estates in the empire.
meanings.sent2: The palatine's lineage traced back to ancient Rome.
meanings.sent3: The palatine's chariot races were legendary among the nobility.
meanings.sent4: The palatine's villa overlooked the beautiful Roman countryside.
meanings.sent5: The palatine's influence extended far beyond his own lands.
